channel.title: Client Crashing Error (+ New Information!)
channel.description:
Ok, well in PVP when I cast a spell on someone it makes my client crash and outputs this error....
[code]Exception in thread "Thread-4" java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 629 at client.method101(client.java:7722) at client.method96(client.java:7464) at client.method114(client.java:8836) at client.method62(client.java:3014) at client.method7(client.java:2029) at Applet_Sub1.run(Applet_Sub1.java:119) at client.run(client.java:4468) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)[/code]
Magic works fine on Npc's (No crashing etc.)
Edit: More Info:
Lines where it said the error was are this
1. [code] Class20 class20_1 = Class23.aClass23Array403[class30_sub2_sub4_sub1.anInt1520].aClass20_407;[/code]
2.[code]method101(class30_sub2_sub4_sub1, -805);[/code]
3. [code] method96(46988, 1, class30_sub2_sub4_sub1_sub2);[/code]
4. [code]method114((byte)-74);[/code]
5. [code]method57(false);[/code]
6.[code]method7(24869);[/code]
7. [code] super.run();[/code]
Here's a GIF of it
[img]http://71.61.61.170/Crash.gif[/img]

item.title: Client Crashing Error (+ New Information!)
item.dc:creator: @Skype1 Skype™
item.description:
@Skype1 wrote:

Ok, well in PVP when I cast a spell on someone it makes my client crash and outputs this error…

Exception in thread "Thread-4" java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 629 at client.method101(client.java:7722) at client.method96(client.java:7464) at client.method114(client.java:8836) at client.method62(client.java:3014) at client.method7(client.java:2029) at Applet_Sub1.run(Applet_Sub1.java:119) at client.run(client.java:4468) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

Magic works fine on Npc’s (No crashing etc.)

Edit: More Info:

Lines where it said the error was are this

  1.  Class20 class20_1 = Class23.aClass23Array403[class30_sub2_sub4_sub1.anInt1520].aClass20_407;

2.method101(class30_sub2_sub4_sub1, -805);

  1.  method96(46988, 1, class30_sub2_sub4_sub1_sub2);
  2. method114((byte)-74);
  3. method57(false);

6.method7(24869);

  1.  super.run();

Here’s a GIF of it
